Begin Chapel Consecration Challenge
DM (Nathan) BOT 04-12-2023 01:11
If you wren't questioning the wisdom of accepting this mission, the long trek through the Svalich woods would certainly be a reason to begin. The dense, old growth blocks most of what little light is available in the ovecast day. And, as is often the case in these woods, you have been plagued the entire journey with the sensation of being watched. What kind of church established itself so far from any human settlements? Did it really exist, or was this all some kind of trap for the unwary adventurer? Scanning the cliff nestled in the trees ahead, you catch a glimmer of movement. A man, with a bow - drawn, arrow point down. Staring directly at you. Another rounds the cliff, arms loaded with firewood, heading for one of several mounds spaced evenly around the stone cliff... and then it dawns on you. It isn't a cliff at all - rather, a lichen-covered stone wall, abutted by trees, with a half-collapsed steeply pitched roof the same color as the surrounding foilage. And behind the man with the bow, a doorway into what presumably is the abandoned, soon-to-be reclaimed chapel.
Kadence BOT 04-12-2023 01:23
Kadence quietly kept a tally of the local jobs that turned out to be legitimate, and the number that turned out to be traps or worse. So far, the balance between the two hasn't been so one-sided as to dissuade her from mercenary work, but she did start to rue the number of postings that took her to some remote corner of this misty cesspool. She wasn't the most sociable of travelers, keeping to one side and answering attention with chilly glares. Short and slim, she nonetheless carried a panoply of weaponry including a longarm and a narrow scabbard. An armored jacket of reinforced leather added to her bulk. Upon running into the man with the bow, she kept a fairly relaxed stance, though her hand lingered close to the gun slung over her shoulder by a strap. "Here for the chapel job," she said. "Looking for a 'Father Lancet.'"

DM (Nathan) BOT 04-12-2023 15:32
As the early arrivals wait the rest of the expected party, several additional folks emerge from the woods bearing wood, add it to the stacks, and go back for more. Another woodsman is using the piled wood to build a series of watch fires around the building. The keen-eyed among the group notice that his right arm is a prosthetic, but a very good one. A soft glow begins to dance across swath of roof shingles where the collapsed roof splays into the building, and gradually grows brighter. Clearly, a fire has been lit inside as well. Two more adventurers emerge from the woods, drawing the bowman's attention. _The bowman examines the newcomers, a hint of distain crossing his stony features as he answers the goblin. _ "Yes, this is the chapel. Father Lancet is waiting inside." The bowman swings open the door, and the party enters into a blazingly bright scene. The ruins of the roof and half-rotted pews have all been shoved to one side of the large gathering space. Hundreds of lines composing odd geometric shapes have been scratched into the floor with charcoal. The shapes themselves seem to defy logic as the eye attempts to follow them, lines twisting and intertwining to create shapes that could not exist in three dimensions. Placed throughout the pattern are candles, lamps, glowing crystals, odd mechanical devices, and more than one lump of something flesh-like that seems to be pulsing. Standing in the middle next to an elaborate metal fountain is a tall, gaunt figure swathed in robes. It turns to regard the party, revealing a patterned metal face? Helmet? It is impossible to say exactly what the being is, but it is clearly 'Father Lancet'.

I've cleared out the basement several times now, but the destroyed undead seem to be replaced each time. That's why I sent for you. I need warriors to keep the undead from interrupting again."
DM (Nathan) BOT 04-12-2023 18:23

Many are smashed, revealing they are really just boxes against the blank stone walls, meant to be lit from inside by numerous candle sconces. Dark fabric banners hang between each box, and where they have rotted away narrow arrow slits are revealed in the walls. The surviving stained glass depicts armored knights marching on Castle Ravenloft.

Kadence BOT 04-12-2023 18:34
Stepping inside the chapel, Kadence's eyes wandered unabashedly. They lingered on the odd devices and the pulsing bits of flesh, and a faint suspicious sneer crossed her lips as she observed the scrawling lines. The chapel's location made this entire effort sketchy, and the environs reeked of some kind of occult endeavor. Kadence imagined that if she were not some interloper from afar, or if she was more steeped in the history of this cursed demiplane, she might glean some kind of significance from the stained glass depictions. Quietly, she wondered whether Father Lancet was part of the same tradition that originally built this stone chapel, or if he too was some kind of interloper. Nevertheless, she was the mercenary sort, and she listened to Father Lancet's description of the task. Focusing on the job at hand, she added another inquiry, "What kind of undead are rising up from below?"

DM (Nathan) BOT 05-12-2023 15:47

DM (Nathan) BOT 05-12-2023 16:03
As you enter into the crypt proper, the quality of the air seems to change - it grows colder, damper, greasy somehow. It takes mental effort to push yourselves forward, and everyone's shoulders hunch a bit as you push on - except Severin, who's shoulders remain squared and moves forward undaunted. The crypt is a stone-walled room, the same size as the church above, with the sturdy stone ceiling supported by massive columns and the walls of niches set along the sides of the room. In the center of the room is a row of stone coffins, and additional coffins rest each of the niches, as does a massive sculpture of a warrior in robes and armor. And milling about the crypt are six shambling humanoid corpses... zombies. They haven't seemed to notice you yet... And then chanting begins from above, and six heads immediately swivel to the stairs where the sound is echoing into the chamber.

Kadence BOT 05-12-2023 18:59
Kadence was prickly about her personal space, and tensed when the priest approached. But she endured having a symbol drawn on her head; the woman was not particularly reverent or religious, but she did recognize the power of the gods. When he was done, she dragged a pair of crystal lens goggles over her eyes and descended into the crypt. The atmosphere immediately worsened her tense demeanor. Gritting her teeth through it, she subconsciously leaned forward to present a smaller profile as she stalked into the uncomfortably cold, damp place. She held her longarm at the ready, barrel lowered slightly but swiveling along with her vision. Between the dim, lingering lights, the luminescence coming from Warden behind her, and the dark vision offered by her goggles, she was able to spy the shambling figure clumsily making its way towards her. Almost dismissively, she sidestepped its lurching swing before driving the barrel of her weapon right up against its chin. The point-blank discharge shattered its skull, the loud shot partially muffled by meat. She snapped open the break-hinge of her weapon, loaded another bullet right into the breech, and quickly swung it up for another shot. This time, the crypt was briefly illuminated in the sharp relief of gunfire as her second shot tore into a zombie in front of her.

Kadence BOT 29-12-2023 21:26
The front-line had collapsed, the bulk of the zombies were behind her, and Kadence had another one of those carrion-eaters slowly eating at her through her jacket. A glance over her shoulder revealed chaos. A number of the zombies were melting from acid and running madly around to the corners of the room, but a handful were still single-mindedly pushing towards the stairwell. Kadence spat to the side and steeled herself. This feeling of dread was not unfamiliar; she recalled similarly desperate melees where her crew and ship were outmatched. And now, as then, her instincts pushed towards aggression. When most of the enemy has bypassed you, that left you in a position to go after the head. Reversing her blade grip, she cut through the webbing binding her despite the awkward angle.
